intro: Bupleurum junceum var. wettsteinianum, commonly known as the Wettstein's goat's beard, is a perennial herb native to the mountainous regions of central and southern Europe. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, characterized by its umbellate inflorescences and aromatic foliage. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring finely divided, fern-like leaves and small, white to pale yellow flowers. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in alpine meadows and rocky habitats. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal potential, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens and herbal practices.
